author: Staff Reporter
text:
They will offer various comforts to voters

Two of the 274 polling booths, including three auxiliary booths, in Thoothukudi Assembly constituency are emerging as ‘model booths’, offering various comforts to voters as well as polling personnel, according to Returning Officer of Thoothukudi constituency S. Gopala Sundara Raj.

These emerging model booths, to be established at Corporation Middle School at Sivanthakulam and Corporation Primary School at Tooveypuram, would have adequate furniture to handle all election-related works, and the concrete structures would be painted freshly to provide a good atmosphere, he told The Hindu here. These two booths would have voter facilitation centres to assist voters in polling. The volunteers to be present at the facilitation centres would help the voters get their booth slips.

Mr. Gopala Sundara Raj said that volunteers would also be roped in to render help in managing voters waiting in queues. Waiting rooms with necessary facilities, including drinking water, would be in place in these special booths.

For the elderly and tired voters, waiting rooms would be established, and they cast votes after resting a while. Ramp would be set up to help the differently abled access the booths.

Each of the model booths would have six volunteers. The required facilities would be made as per the specifications of the Election Commission of India.

A total of 28 booths in Thoothukudi constituency were considered ‘sensitive booths’, Mr. Gopala Sundara Raj said.
title: Two model polling booths in Thoothukudi
